import java.*;
import java.io.*;
import java.net.*;

public class BasicBot extends BaseCode
{

		super(userName,userPass,UserDescription,Ip,Port);

class BaseCode
{
	/*Main Varibles For Connecting*/
	private String Ip = "";
	private int port;
	private boolean connected;
	private Socket connector;
	private BufferedReader input;
	private BufferedWriter output;

	/*Main Varibles For Identy*/
	private String userName = "";
	private String UserDescription = "";
	private String userPass = "";
	private boolean Identified;

	/*Main Varibles For Channels*/
	private String[] channels = {"#java","#testing"};

	/*User For Making This Our Super Class*/
	public BaseCode(String userName,String userPass,String UserDescription,String Ip,int Port)
	{
		this.userName = userName;
		this.userPass = userPass;
		this.UserDescription = UserDescription;
		this.Ip = Ip;
		this.port = Port;
	}

	/*Connecting To A Irc Server*/
	public void connect()
	{
		try
		{
			connector = new Socket(Ip, port);
		}
		catch(Exception E)
		{
			System.out.println(E.toString());
			E.printStackTrace();
		}
	}
	/*user To Identifing,Joining Channels, and setting modes*/
	public void setup()
		{
			Send("USER " + userName + " 8 & " + UserDescription);
			Send("NICK " + userName);
			Send("Mode " + userName + " +BpT");
			if(userPass != null)
			{
				Send("NS IDENTIFY " + userPass);
			}
			for(int X = 0; X < channels.length; X++)
			{
				if(channels[X] != null)
				{
					Send("JOIN " + channels[X]);
				}
			}
			connected = true;
	}
	/*Used To Send Data To The Irc Server*/
	public void Send(String Sent)
	{
		try
		{
			output = new BufferedWriter(new OutputStreamWriter(connector.getOutputStream()));
			output.write(Sent);
			output.newLine();
			output.flush();
		}
		catch(Exception E)
		{
		System.out.println(E.toString());
		}
	}

	/*used To Run Our Class*/
	public void Running()
	{
		try
		{
			while(connected)
			{
				input = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(connector.getInputStream()));
				String inComingData = null;
				while((inComingData = input.readLine()) != null)
				{
					String[] entries = inComingData.split(" ");
					String[] user = entries[0].split("!");
					user[0] = user[0].replaceAll(":","");
					String command = entries[1];
					String channel = "";
					String arguments = "";
					for(int amount = 2; amount < entries.length; amount++)
					{
						if(amount == 2)
						{
							channel = entries[amount];
						}
						else
						{
							arguments = arguments + " "+entries[amount];
						}
					}
					if (inComingData.contains("PING"))
					{
						ping(inComingData);
					}
					else
					{
						System.out.println("USER : "+ user[0] + " COMMAND : " + command + " CHANNEL : "+channel+" ARGUMENTS : "+arguments+"\n");
					}
				}
			}
		}
		catch(Exception E)
		{
			E.printStackTrace();
		}
	}

	public boolean ping(String msg) throws IOException
	{
		if(msg.substring(0,4).equalsIgnoreCase("ping"))
		{
			String pongmsg = "pong " + msg.substring(5);
			Send(pongmsg);
			System.out.println("pong");
			return true;
		}
		return false;
	}
}

//flush, flush, flush!
}

[/quote]This is where it actually connects, first it tries to create a socket with the server you set, right now to freenode. Then if your bot is registered, it identifies itself with the server so that it’s name won’t get changed.

item.title: How to make an irc bot
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

[quote=“Eh Pretty Easy, post:1, topic:199481”] outGoing.write("MODE " + USER + " :+i\n"); outGoing.write("MODE " + USER + " :-f\n"); [/quote]

Modes are set like this in IRC:

MODE user/channel mode

Not:

MODE user/channel :mode

So that code won’t work.

[quote=“Eh Pretty Easy, post:1, topic:199481”] if (inComingData.contains("PING")) { outGoing.write("PING"); } [/quote]

Ping is responded to using PONG. Also, if you receive something like this:

PING :somethinghere

You must respond like this:

PONG :somethinghere

Now down to more basic Java problems:

BotMain main = new BotMain();

Where is your BotMain class? You haven’t created one.

You wouldn’t even need to do a main.connect();. You could just do connect(); (which would be the proper way because it is static).

Really, you should test your code before you post it.
